Question: This person "says that 'on the subject of reasoning' he 'had nothing else on an earlier date to speak of'".
Hints: Ayn Rand accredited this person as "the greatest philosopher in history" and cited him as a major influence on her thinking.
With the loss of the study of ancient Greek in the early medieval Latin West, this person was practically unknown there from c.
This person's metaphysics contains observations on the nature of numbers but he made no original contributions to mathematics.
